result.execSummary:
The defendant William Robert Kelly III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo a domestic abuse assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall not have any contact with C.P. or her residence for the duration of the agreement.

Defendant shall abide by all rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if Defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Complete domestic abuse assessment and comply with treatment recommendations if not already completed.

Comply with all assessments and conditions per agent.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.

Take prescribed medications as prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
